To reach the temple you have to drive about 15kms along a winding road but some solace can be found in the magnificent views along the way.

name: Balapokuna Purana Viharaya
description: Although Kotte was a kingdom in the 15th century today it is only a satellite city within the larger city of Colombo but is still considered the nation’s administrative capital. Kotte can be seen from Balapokuna Purana Viharaya which was built on the highest land in Colombo. Part of this temple’s name translates into soldiers and it is thought to be due to it looking down onto a valley which would have been where the soldiers defending Kotte would place their line of defense.

name: Devinuwara Raja Maha Viharaya
description: 6.5kms south east of Matara on Sri Lanka’s southern edge is the town of Devinuwara which is also known as the City of Gods. With a gilded copper roof which flashed far out to sea, the temple here was once very impressive. The many pillars of the temple that remain today with their assortment of sculptures are a testament to the grandeur the temple was presented.

name: Great World's End Drop
description: One of the most popular National Parks in Sri Lanka is Horton Plains National Park and one of the reasons for that is that it is home to what has become known as the Great World's End Drop. This is where a huge rock face drops an amazing 880 meters and provides visitors to the top with views that stretch for miles.

name: Ran Masu Uyana (Royal Goldfish Park)
description: Pleasure gardens have always been a feature in Sri Lanka from even before the introduction of Buddhism in the 3rd century BC. It is from that same period which the Ran Masu Uyana (Royal Goldfish Park) is thought to have been created. The gardens covered an area of 40 acres and the remains of some of its features can still be seen today.

name: Pulun Ella Falls
description: The Pulun Ella Falls are located in the Ratnapura District of Sri Lanka and whilst the total height of this waterfall is 86 meters it is divided into 2 segments. The 1st segment is 9 meters but drops the water into a pool which when overflowing allows the water to drop the rest of the way down the rock slab.

name: Dambana Vedda Village
description: Dambana Vaddha Village boarders the Maduru Oya Wildlife Reservation and is the home to the last aboriginal people of Sri Lanka. Their leader for more than 100 years until his death at the age of 116 in 1998 was Tisahamy and villagers will be happy to take you to his tomb in the nearby jungle.

name: Lighthouse at Foul Point
description: The Lighthouse at Foul Point, sometimes referred to as the Sampur lighthouse, was built in 1863 and so has been guiding seafarers for many years. The 32 meter high lighthouse has 5 levels but due to it being neglected through the war years prior to 2007, the stairs are unsafe to climb.

name: Handagala Kanda Ancient cave Temple
description: The Anuradhapura kingdom began around the 4th century BC and is remembered by its majestic monuments. One perhaps lesser known of these monuments is the Handagala Kanda Ancient cave Temple which is located on a hill 300 feet above its surroundings.

name: Vankalai Beach
description: Vankalai Beach is in Sri Lanka’s Northern Province but due to a lack of facilities it is less popular than other beaches in the area however, it is still a great place to see sunsets.

name: Vihara Maha Devi Park
description: Next to Sri Lanka’s National Museum in the capital Colombo is the Vihara Maha Devi Park. The park is a public place which used to be called Victoria Park and is home to a mini-zoo, fountains and a statue of Buddha.

name: Anawilundawa Sanctuary
description: In the north west of Sri Lanka, in the Puttalam district, is the 1,397 hectares of the Anawilundawa Sanctuary. This sanctuary is perhaps unique as it consists of 3 different eco systems, mangroves, coast and fresh water tanks which in turn make it an ideal site for hundreds of different types of birds to nest. The sanctuary is also called home by many species of butterflies and at least 20 types of reptiles, amphibians and mammals, including the Rusty Spotted cat.

name: Neluwa Dowili Ella Falls
description: Although there are a lot of waterfalls in the Sinharaja Rain Forest, many of which are in the Galle District, one of the most popular ones is Neluwa Dowili Ella Falls with a height of 17 meters. As this waterfall is so popular with foreign tourists as well as locals, steps have now been built to their top.

name: Mandaramnuwara Ethiniwala Ella
description: Although seemingly undocumented the Mandaramnuwara Ethiniwala Ella waterfall does exist and is 16 meters in height. From the Mandaramnuwara road the falls can only be seen 90 meters in the distance but can be reached by asking a local villager for directions for the path to the falls.

name: Sri Nagala Statue Mid Mountain
description: Having a history going as far as King Devanampiyatissa (250-210 BC), the Sri Nagala Rajamaha Viharaya lies at the Nikawewa mountain range's foothill between Moragollagama and Madagalla. The temple had been neglected and deserted for an extended period, and now it had been re-developed and restored.

name: Sunandarama Maha Viharaya
description: Located 65kms north of Colombo but just 200 meters from Ambalangoda Railway Station Sunandarama Maha Viharaya covers an area of 5 acres. Although the temple is thought to have been originally built around 1750, some additions were made later, such as the cairn in 1843, the two storied building from 1983 and the frescoes from around 1805.

name: Ruins of Ancient Hennaanigala cave Temple
description: Hennaanigala is a massive rock 11kms from Maha Oya lying adjacent to the Maya Oya – Aralaganwila Road. It is said that the monastery at the foot of the rock, which has one of the longest drip ledges in Sri Lanka, is where Prince Dutugemunu gathered his men for the final attack on the invaders from South India.

name: Thiruketheeswaram Kovil
description: The Thiruketheeswaram Kovil located in the heart of Mantai is said to have been built and maintained by merchants from South India and be dedicated to the Shiva deity. The temple always comes alive with lights at the annual Maha Sivaratri, a festival celebrating Shiva.

name: Bambaragala Forest Monastery
description: Although today the Bambaragala Forest Monastery is a monastery, it has only recently become one. This site is thought to have been an ancient temple which flourished from the 3rd century BC until the 12th century. After that time it was abandoned until becoming the site for today’s monastery. Built on a mountain and locals believe it was once used as a fortress. Ruins of a wall which may have formed part of a fortress have been found at the top of the mountain which helps substantiate the locals’ beliefs.

name: Ratnayake Motors
description: Phone Number - 372281010

name: Kankasanthure (KKS) Lighthouse
description: Surrounded by a fortified wall the Kankasanthure Lighthouse stands 22 meters high but today, thanks to the civil war, now looks disheveled and is dysfunctional.

name: Ceypetco Filling Station - Udawatta Road, Horana
Indian Hut
description: Some of the best Indian on the Island (note: opinions differ)

name: Pabalu Vehera - Polonnaruwa Kingdom
description: The stupa found at Pabalu Vehera which dates back to the Polonnaruwa Kingdom in the 12th century is unusual for two reasons, firstly it has an unusual shape and secondly it contains nine image houses instead of the usual four. The original name of this site was not known but was given the name Pabalu, meaning ‘Beads’ due to a large number of beads being found there at the first excavations.

name: Madhu Church
description: The Roman Catholic Madhu Church in Sri Lanka is also known as the Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu which serves as Sri Lanka’s holiest place for Catholics on the island. In 1924 Pope Pius XI made a Canonical coronation of the image of Our Lady of Madhu.

name: Ganegodella Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The Ganegodella Rajamaha Viharaya is said to have been originally built in the 12th century but due to it being destroyed by Portuguese and the Dutch was rebuilt again in the Kandyan Kingdom era. Although some of the statues in the image house are today made of clay, the murals on the walls, which are in various states of decay, seem original.

name: Ambulugala Homestay
description:
Ambulugala Homestay offers a peaceful, authentic escape surrounded by lush greenery and nature. Located just a short drive from ambuluwawa we provide comfortable accommodations, traditional Sri Lankan meals, and warm hospitality. Ideal for travelers seeking relaxation, cultural experiences, and adventure.

Ambulugala Homestay is happy to offer a 50% discount on the second night for guests booking through TukTukRental.com. This offer will be subject to availability and advance booking, and we believe it strikes a great balance between value and sustainability.

name: Rathganga Asu Maha Shrawaka Pasvisu Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Each year many pilgrims from Sri Lanka pay homage to the birthplace of Prince Siddartha who was born in Nepal to India’s north. Today the Rathganga Asu Maha Shrawaka Pasvisu Rajamaha Viharaya has been built in a mountainous setting as a replica to what can be found on that further pilgrimage.

name: Entrance to the Secret Tunnel of Kotte Kingdom
description: The Kotte Kingdom is said to have 3 secret tunnels but today 1 is no longer a secret and is located near the Ananda Sasthrayala School. In times of warfare or trouble these tunnels were used to evacuate women and families.

name: Kanabadu Ella Falls
description: Although the waters that flow over the 30 meter high Kanabadu Ella Falls come from an aquifer the water rarely ceases to flow except unless there is a very severe drought. A local legend tells of a Cyclops that lives near the falls.

name: Flying Ravana Zipline
description: Located in the lush green estates of Ella the Flying Ravana Zipline is the fastest and longest zipline in Sri Lanka. With 2 ziplines stretching for a distance of half a kilometer, adventures and just brave nature lovers can experience a unique way to see the beauty that Sri Lanka’s hills have to offer.

name: Delft Island - Ruins of Horse Stable
description: Deft Island, which is usually reached by ferry but can be flown to, is rich in history from Sri Lanka’s colonial period. One of the many attractions for visitors is the old stables where a giant footprint can be seen. Legend has it that this footprint and one other on the island, were made by a giant 40 feet in height.

name: Pahiyangala caves
description: Pahiyangala caves are also known to some as Fa Hien Cave as, according to legend, that is the name of a monk who used to reside in the cave. However, no evidence has been discovered to merit the legend, what has been found in the caves though does interest professionals as prehistoric skeletal remains were found in the sediment of the cave.

name: Diyaluma Ella Falls
description: At a height of 220 meters, the Diyaluma Ella Falls are the 2nd highest in Sri Lanka. Legend has it that once a chieftain had been banished to live in the highlands, he attempted to haul his betrothed up the rock face but she bounced off the face and died. The gods then created the waterfall to hide the scene of the accident.

name: Rathnayaka Moters - Sigiriya
description: Main mechanics in Sigiriya

name: Tangalle Beach
description: When you talk about the beach at Tangalle you have several to choose from. Although all the beaches have what you would expect from a beach, each one around the town of Tangalle has something different for you to experience so take your choice.

name: Rifas Motors. - Pottuvil
description: Phone Number - 75 268 2028

name: Koneswaram Kovil
description: Although the Koneswaram Kovil is a temple which dates back to 1580 BC it still receives pilgrims and visitors by the boatload today. The temple was founded to worship the main Hindu God Shiva and was probably at its peak in the 6th century BC during the exile of Prince Vijayan from India.

name: Badda Sema Malakaya
description: Also known as Buddha Seema Pasada, Badda Sema Malakaya at Polonnaruwa includes the chapter house where the Order of the Buddhist monks was maintained. The monks, with the chief monk seated higher, would meet once every fortnight to recite the rules of the order.

name: Sigiriya Lion Face Restaurant
description: TukTuk rental guest can claim 5% discountÂ

name: Gal Viharaya - Polonnaruwa
description: Located in the Central Province of Sri Lanka at the ancient city of Polonnaruwa, Gal Viharaya is a rock temple of the Buddha. There is some controversy among experts as to whether the rock carvings at this site are of Buddha or of the Monk Ananada.

name: Madukanda temple
description: As a Pre-Christain temple, Madukanda Temple is probably the most interesting of several temples built prior to the 7th century in Vavuniya. Close to the temple an inscription describing grain bank operations in the area by King Sirimeghavanna is considered to be one of Sri Lanka’s most important rock inscriptions.
Phone Number - 758310508

name: Ethagala Rock (Yala NP)
description: Located in the Yale National Park there are a total of 7 giant rocks which overlook the Kurunegala Town. With a face reaching 316 meters in height, Ethagala Rock or Elephant Rock is 1 of them. This particular rock gets its name because its shape resembles that of an elephant which is crouching.

name: Waruna Motors
description: Mechanic mentioned that he is doing cushion works also.

name: Nawagala Rajamaha Viharaya
description: As seen today with a circumference of 275 feet and a height of 60 feet the stupa at Nawagala Rajamaha Viharaya can clearly be seen. However this was not always the case as it had laid abandoned for centuries and become covered in earth and foliage until it was recently rediscovered by archaeologists who restored it.

name: Kabalana Beach
description: Kabalana Beach is an ideal place for beginners to learn how to surf. There are some strong rip currents on the south part of the beach and there are no lifeguards on duty but there are several surfing schools to keep surfers well advised of safety measures.

name: Sharda Motors
description: Phone Number - 777919811

name: Siri Sambuddha Prathiharya Viharaya
description: Siri Sambuddha Prathiharya Viharaya is a temple which was built in 2006 on 10acres of land and includes 500 statues of bhikkhus following the Buddha. All the statues are life size and individual.

name: Wife's Kitchen by Roshan
description:
Huge meal. Very non-tourist mama-style backwater place but still with an English menu. Our best meal so far I think.
-Adam Reece, 2024

name: Lanka Ella Falls
description: The 32 meter high Lanka Ella Falls, due to it only being accessible by foot, is one waterfall in Sri Lanka which is unspoiled by human activity. The falls which get its name due to it looking like a tear drop, is about 1km from the better known Bambarakanda Falls road.

name: Mannar Fort
description: Located on the island of Mannar the Mannar Fort was built by the Portuguese in 1560. Although the Portuguese surrendered to the Dutch in 1658 it was 1696 before the Dutch rebuilt it. The fort again changed hands in 1795 when the Dutch surrendered to the British.

name: Mihintale Maha Seya
description: The first thing you see when travelling towards Mihintale, as it is the largest stupa built, is the Mihintale Maha Seya. The stupa is even more conspicuous as it was built halfway up a hill near the Trincomalee road. The stupa is believed to have been built by King Mahadathika Mahanaga in the 1st century.

name: Kilinochchi - Mulativu Route
description: Until 2008 the Kilinochchi - Mulativu Route had been a terrorist stronghold for 30 years of brutal warfare and today signs or remnants of those bloody years can be seen all along this route.

name: Kurullangala Prehistoric cave Art Site
description: In the Karandagolla area of Sri Lanka at the top of a difficult to ascend rock top is a place known as Kurullangala. This location came to the world’s attention in 2013 when some caves were found there and the caves were covered in rock art believed to date back 5000 years and be of a type not seen anywhere else in the country before.

name: Kota Wehera
description: A huge mound of earth is unfortunately all that is left of Kota Vehera at Dedigama. There are said to be only 3 stupas of the Kota Vehera style, with a truncated hemispherical shape on top, a style favoured by  King Parakramabahu the Great.

name: Sandagirigodella
description: Belonging to the Sandagiri Monastic Complex from the 3rd century BC, Sandagirigodella has recently become a conserved site and consists of 2 remarkable buildings. The first is an image house with an excellently preserved statue of Buddha, all be it with one hand broken off. The second is what is remains of the Sandagirigodella Monastery which was built on huge pillars 15’ tall.

name: Thudugala Ella
description: The 8 meter high Thudugala Ella waterfall is located in the Thudugala Estate in the Kalutara District. This waterfall is a popular bathing spot with locals and has one unusual feature and that is that there is a tunnel under the waterfall which leads up and to the side of the fall.

name: Dilhan Motors trinco
description: Trinco helper and mehcanic

name: Rambadagalla Viharaya
description: When the Bamiyan Buddha in Afghanistan was destroyed in 2001 by the Taliban it inspired the youth of a village, Rambadagalla, in the Kurunegala District of Sri Lanka to take action. It started with them but the idea soon spread and people from all around contributed to build a replica 67.5 granite statue in that same village.

name: Maligawila Buddha Statue
description: The largest free standing statue of Buddha in Sri Lanka was created in the 7th century and stands in the village of Maligawila in the Moneragala District. Although it was in several pieces when first rediscovered in 1951, in 1980 it was reconstructed.

name: Asanka Motors
description: these mechanics do work with 3 wheel repairs.

name: Lenagala Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The largest cave inscriptions in the Western province of Sri Lanka in a unique cave temple named Lenagala Rajamaha Viharaya. The cave temple is situated on the top of a hill under a huge cave. Each of the letters on the inscriptions are 1” deep and 7” tall.

name: Maamangeswaram Pillaiyar Kovil
description: The Maamangeswaram Pillaiyar Kovil as well as the Old Dutch Fort, The Lady Manning Bridge (Old Kallady Bridge) and Bath Lighthouse are all sites in Batticaloa Town which visitors can see in just one day.

name: Shafran Motors - Tangalle
description: A customer found this mechanic, and he has informed us that he can go and fix tuk-tuks as well.  Phone Number - +94 712 911 888.

name: Mount Vernon Falls
description: Well away from the Nawalapitiya – Dimbulla Road, hidden away in the Dimbulla region are the 12 meter high Mount Vernon Falls. Although out of sight from the casual traveller the falls can be accessed through the nearby tea estate.

name: Sandun Motors - Kurunegala
description: Ready to visit the customers at there location to fix the tuktuk within 5KM radius

name: Rakkhiththakanda Ancient cave Temple
description: Although the Rakkhiththakanda Ancient cave Temple is thought to have existed since the 1st century BC is certainly has had some renovations, probably during the Kandyan Era as there are hints at British influence in some of the paintings, such as the British royal symbol and one that resembles the British Queen.

name: Palchenai Beach, Batticaloa
description: Palchenai Beach is just one of several beautiful beaches in or around Batticaloa which is attracting foreign tourists. Of course, the history of Sri Lanka alone can keep tourists busy but it is always nice to relax on a sandy beach for a day or two.

name: Mysterious Halaba Steel Bridge
description: The reason why the British built a 372 foot steel bridge across the Uma Oya river at Halaba when no roads seem to have ever existed there remains a mystery.  To further compound the mystery is the fact that the bridge was built at the widest part of the river.

name: Horagolla National Park
description: Located about 40kms from Colombo is a recreational center which is part of the Horagolla National Park. This is one of Sri Lanka’s more recently named national Parks and is particularly important due to its abundance of Dipterocarpus zeylanicus (hora) trees.

name: Thivanka Image House
description: The Thivanka Image House built by King Parakramabahu in the 12th century at the Jethavanarama Complex has walls which are between 7 and 12 feet thick which means its outer dimensions are far larger than its internal ones. Thivanka means three curves and the image house has been given this name due to its 8 meter high statue of Buddha having three identifiable curves.

name: Lenkiri Ella Falls
description: To reach the Lenkiri Ella Falls it takes a hike through jungle with a full canopy and so little light or warmth can be experienced on the trek. The hike however is worth it as the falls are in 3 sections but the lower section which is 20 meters high is a sheer drop and so presents a spectacular sight.

name: Morapaya Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Located along the Rikillagaskada road a little past Hanguranketa, the Morapaya Rajamaha Viharaya has a23” gold plated image of Buddha. The image was lost in a landslide in the 17th century but it was later restored having been found by two merchants.

name: Pilikuththuwa Raja Maha Vihara
description: It is believed that the caves of the Pilikuththuwa Raja Maha Vihara had been inhabited since prehistoric times. Although there are said to be a total of 99 caves, only 77 have so far been identified and marked.

name: Moray Falls
description: Located in the shadow of and fed by a stream originating from the Samanala Mountain Range, the 30 meter high Moray Falls are situated on the Moray Estate. Although not officially listed anywhere these falls are fairly popular with visitors to the region.

name: Arisimale Beach
description: Although this beach, located in Trincomalee, is small, it is an excellent place to relax and unwind. The beach is known for its unusual sand which resembles rice rather than regular sand.

name: Miella Kanda / Kotiyagala Ruins
description: Located at Kotiyagala on a mountain called Miella kanda, in 2 large caves are what must be the ruins of an ancient cave temple complex. In 1 of the caves although it has been damaged by treasure hunters, there is a Buddha statue whilst untouched the ceiling is covered in paintings of Buddha reclining.

name: Pelmadulla Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Somewhat unusually there are two temples at Pelmadulla Rajamaha Viharaya, one which was built over 400 years ago and a second built by the British in the 19th century. The temple built by the British has some Christian aspects in it, such as a cross, an image that resembles the Virgin Mary and a couple of angels. It is thought that these were included in a Buddhist Temple, not as an insult but as an indication that all were welcome to worship in this temple.

name: Ruwanara Royal Majestry
description: The place is pretty well maintained and clean.

name: Thimbiriya Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Although it is thought that Thimbiriya Raja Maha Viharaya was built in the 2nd century BC, excavations have found that it has also had links to more modern colonial times as among the finds were some Dutch coins.

name: Kalutara Temple
description: Standing at the entrance to the city of Kalutara is the Kalutara Temple where it is believed that 1 of the 32 original Bodhi tree saplings was planted. What is unique about this temple is the fact that it is the only one in the world believed to have a hollow stupa and it is said that inside the stupa are murals depicting Buddha’s previous life.

name: Anura Motors
description: Phone Number - 767639946

name: Galamuna Samadhi Statue (Bisobandara Viharaya)
description: There are numerous good seated Buddha staues in Sri Lanka’s National Muxeum but that does not mean there are not many others around the country, such as the granite Samadhi Statue in Galamuna. In an area known as Bisobandara it is believed that the statue’s location was once monastery built by princess Bisobandara who was the sister of King Mahasen (276-303).

name: Bulankulame Walawwa
description: Although the square bungalow by the Bulankulame Wewa is reportedly the oldest house in Sri Lanka, with its recently tiled veranda, it doesn’t look it. Bulankulame Walawwa is believed to be more than 400 years old and is today divided into 2 parts, one part is occupied whilst the other has been left in its original condition.

name: Shantha Motors
description: Phone Number - 761237044

name: Main Refectory of Abayagiri Monastery
description: According to the Chinese travelling monk Fa-Hien who visited Sri Lanka in the 6th century, 5000 monks would reside at the Abayagiri Monastery and that meant all of them would eat their meals in the large main refectory. With walls 42.7 meters long this square building was first built in the 1st century BC but further construction took place on it on no less than three later occasions.

name: Hollombuwa Sthreepura cave Temple
description: Considering its closeness to Colombo the Hollombuwa Sthreepura cave Temple is surprisingly immersed in a lavish green country setting. The temple is perhaps best known for its large cave which is said to have hidden 500 Queens in its hay day.

name: Jayathilaka Motors
description: Spare part shop and mechanic. There is a battery shop close to this shop. Phone Number - 767176100

name: Arugam Bay Beach
description: Arugam Bay Beach is popular with tourists as it has ideal conditions for surfers and has hosted more international surfing events than any other beach in Sri Lanka. Although once also popular with local fishermen, since the civil war fishermen have been deterred from using this beach in favour of hotels and tourism.

name: New Lakshan Motors
description: Mechanic found by  the Customers.

name: Mini World's End - Madulsima
description: Most visitors to Sri Lanka will have heard of World’s End but they may not realize that there are also 4 Mini world’s Ends. One of the mini world ends is located Madulsima 180kms from Colombo and this one is on the Roeberry Estate, a tea plantation about 3000 feet above sea level. The drop from the view point is 1257 feet allowing for beautiful panoramic views.

name: British Garrison Cemetery of Kandy
description: In 1817 the British established a cemetery in Kandy for British nationals who died on the island. Due to the city banning burials within city limits in 1837, special permission had to be obtained for future burials but the last burial took place in 1951. In 1998 the cemetery containing 195 graves was restored with funding from the Commonwealth War Graves Commission and is today maintained by a local group of volunteers, “The Friends of the British Garrison Cemetery in Kandy”.

name: Akurukaduwa Limestone cave and the Cascade
description: This cave has a very small entrance and so a guide will be needed to find it. The cascade which is near to the cave and also accessed through the same paddy field is also relatively unknown. Although both are magnificent, visitors often find the cave most interesting as few have seen such a large cave before.

name: Padanagaraya I & II of Anuradhapura
description: Padanagaraya were buildings built by monks away from cities but within reach of their monastery. These buildings, would usually have a twin nearby which is the case with the two Padanagaraya near the Abhayagirya monastery in what would have been the Anuradhapura Kingdom. These two Padanagaraya are located about 1.5kms apart and as with most, have moats around them.

name: Talaimannar Lighthouse.
description: The Talaimannar Lighthouse also known as Mannar Island Lighthouse was built in 1915 to a height of 19 meters with a round tower. The lighthouse was built on a site which had been considered building a bridge to mainland India in 1894.

name: Ekiriyankumbura Endagala Archaeological Site
description: Although still being excavated it is believed that the Ekiriyankumbura Endagala Archaeological Site contains a garden complex used by ancient kings. One aspect of the site which has not been ravaged by treasure hunters is a pool with a drain and a shelf at a height ideal for sitting. It is believed that this was used by royalty for bathing but no evidence has yet been found as to how the pool received water

name: Hiriketiya Beach
description: Due to its curved shape Hiriketiya Beach receives waves which are suitable for surfing. Located on Sri Lanka’s southern coast this beach is not the most popular surfing spot but that can be an advantage for the surfers who know the beach.

name: JAYASUNDARA MOTORS AND SERVICE CENTER
description: Mechanic- 0776119821,  From Sanasa bank 800 m towards Halmillewa Junction

name: Kinihirikanda Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Located in a 550 foot hill Kinihirikanda Rajamaha Viharaya consisted of at least 24 caves but it is thought that another 24 may have been sealed. The carvings on the temple’s water tanks seem to date back to the 1st century BC to the reign of king Walagambahu.

name: Olumadu Ruins
description: Many historic Buddhist sites in the north of the country were destroyed during Sri Lanka’s 30 year civil war but at the Olumadu Ruins, thanks to the army marking it out as a place of worship, some remains of stupas, Buddha statues and Buddha footprints can still be seen.

name: Uduwara Ella Falls
description: Although you will have to trek 2kms in order to see the 80 meter high Uduwara Ella Falls, at least you will be able to also see the Nagadowa Ella Falls from the same vantage point.

name: Masjidul Abrar Jumma Mosque
description: Dating back to 920 AD it is believed that the Masjidul Abrar Jumma Mosque in Beruwala was the first mosque built in Sri Lanka. Although the mosque no longer exists the area where it once stood is remembered as being the first place where Arab Mulims set foot on the island and established themselves in the bay region.

name: King Nissanga Malla Audience Hall
description: With a throne carved as a massive Lion and inscribed Throne of the King the King Nissanga Malla Audience Hall is made from solid rock with 48 stone pillars lined up in fours to support what is suspected to have been a wooden roof.

name: Mapagala ancient fortress
description: The use of square hammered stones in the ramparts of the Mapagala ancient fortress seems to signify that this region was one of the first to use iron-smelting. This theory is further strengthened when stone forges were discovered in some caves in the Kiri-Oya valley a little to the east of the fortress.

name: Community Tsunami Education Center & Museum
description: Designed to take visitors through an experience of a tsunami the Community Tsunami Education Center & Museum hopes to better prepare visitors for any future similar occasions as the devastating tsunami in 2004.

name: Beruwatte Ella Falls
description: Set among an assortment of mountain flora and fauna and tea plantations, the 50 meter high Beruwatte Ella Falls are located where several brooks converge. The white cascading waters of the falls look like cotton draped down the mountain and at the bottom is a large rock ideal for meditation.

name: Gamini motors
description: Phone Number - 712170234

name: All Angels in Colpetty (Gal Palliya)
description: With its origins dating back to 1844 the All Angels’ Church in Colpetty is rich in architecture, antiquities and religious artifacts. One of the attractions in the church is the tiled floor in the sanctuary. The tiles are brown, yellow and blue but each tile is imprinted with something relating to the passion and death of Jesus Christ.

name: Lakshmi Narayana Perumal Kovil, Trincomalee
description: With bright colours of gold and sky blue the Lakshmi Narayana Perumal Kovil at Trincomalee welcomes pilgrims from across the plains. On closer inspection the devotees will see it is also ornately decorated with colourful sculptures and carvings.

name: Nellikulama Sirisambuddha Panchasathika Charikaramaya
description: To represent Buddha and his 500 followers crossing Sri Lanka spreading the words of Buddhism, the Nellikulama Sirisambuddha Panchasathika Charikaramaya which was built in 2006 on 10 acres of land near Anuradhapura has 500 individual statues of monks, each one different, following Buddha.

name: Fresh Start Sugar Cane & Juice Bar
Kirivehera Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The great Mahinda Thero visited Sri Lanka in 250 BC and introduced Buddhism to the Island. As well as the words of Buddha he also brought with him a bowl of holy relics which he presented to King Devanampiyatissa. The King placed each holy relic in a separate stupas equidistance apart which he had built equidistance apart to house them. It is believed that one of these original stupas is the one at Kirivehera Rajamaha Viharaya.

name: Wariyapola Sri Sumangala Raja Maha Viharaya
description: It is perhaps no coincidence that the huge granite slab which Wariyapola Sri Sumangala Raja Maha Viharaya is built on is large enough for a modern, medium sized plane to land on. Wariyapola, literally translated, means airport and according to ancient legends, this is the place which was used by the ancients when flying between India and Sri Lanka.

name: Peradeniya Botanical Gardens
description: Also known as the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya Botanical Gardens the gardens cover an area of 147 acres 5.5kms west of Kandy. Although the gardens are home to over 4000 species of plant and is attached to Sri Lanka’s National Herbarium, it is perhaps best known for its collection of assorted Orchid.

name: Thini Oya Ella / Besam Ella
description: Known by any of three names, Thini Oya Ella, Besam Ella or Biso Falls the waterfall at Pambagola Village in the Ratnapura District is 45 meters high and can be reached after a 1kms hike. The waterfall starts at three pools at the top of two rock ledges over which it then cascades into the Hirigadu River.

name: Shiva Kovil (no. 2) of Polonnauwa Kingdom
description: The 2nd Kovil you will come to in Polonnauwa is in e3xceptionally good condition especially considering it is thought to be the oldest building at the site. The good condition is probably due to the perfect precision used in when setting the stone blocks.

name: Elgin Estate Falls
description: Elgin Falls are located on the Elgin tea estate which was named after a town in Scotland. The main waterfall on the estate is 25 meters high. When travelling by train from Nanu Oya and Ambewela, these falls make an excellent sight in the distance.

name: Miyunu Ella
description: With a height of 60 meters Miyunu Ella is one of two large waterfalls in the Kukulugala Forest in the Ratnapura district of Sri Lanka. Although the water at the bottom of these falls lands in a pool, it then goes through a tunnel to reappear further downstream.

name: Keragala Padmavathi Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Located in Keragala village 6kms from Weliveriya town in the Gampaha District, Keragala Padmavathi Rajamaha Viharaya is a Buddhist temple which is known for 2 inscriptions carved into each side of the sqame stone slab. The inscriptions, written in Sinhalese characters, tell of grants afforded an ancient temple.

name: Nalanda Gedige
description: Since Nalanda Gedige was rediscovered in 1893 archaeologists have determined that is was probably built in the 9th century however, what they cannot determine is why it was designed with a mix of both Hindu and Buddhist architecture.

name: Buddama Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Located in Buddama village the Buddama Rajamaha Viharaya is a historic temple. This complex was built in the 3rd century BC as a vocational training center but after the arrival of Buddhism it was converted into a monastery. The complex consists of more than 20 caves, many of which house murals and the main chamber has statues of Buddha.

name: Asokaramaya (Pankuliya Buddha Statue)
description: Located in the village of Pankuliya this statue is not well-known to pilgrims but remains perhaps one of the best carved Buddha statues in Sri Lanka. The statue is surrounded by ruins of what are thought to have been the remains of an old nunnery.

name: Varana Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Turn right at the Tihariya junction on the Colombo- Kandy road and you will come to Varana Rajamaha Viharaya. This temple is located at the foot of a modest but peculiar looking rock which has an unusually large drip ledge. The temple is an impressive size and consists of 3 levels up the rock with a dagoda at the summit.

name: Great Basses lighthouse
description: Great Basses Lighthouse may not be the tallest in Asia but it probably deserves the name of the loneliest. Located on a reef 12kms from the coast, visitors have to endure a boat ride of over an hour if they wish to see it up close.

name: Tomb of Adam and Eve in Mannar
description: According to Muslim legend, 2 graves, 1 40’ long and the other 38’ long, located on Mannar Island are the graves of Adam and Eve. The legend tells of how they arrived on the island by boat, grew to an amazing height and then were buried on the island once they died.

name: Navalady Beach
description: Navalady Beach on the Navalady Peninsula is a very long beach as it stretches almost the entire length of the peninsula. There are some shady patches along the beach plus some with no shade but given the length of the beach, perhaps hiring a bicycle may allow you to search for your ideal spot.

name: Kasagala Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Located next to a huge boulder the Kasagala Rajamaha Viharaya has 2 caves associated with it. Although the caves are thought to have been used by holy men for centuries are today shrine rooms. The older of the 2 shrines is dark and murky with images of lions and gods whilst the newer of the 2 is bright and with a smell of flowers and incense.

name: Sanjaya Tyre Shop
description: This tyre shop was found to park out a drop off vehicle during and emergency drop off customers can be sent for tyre work for this place

name: Gatabaru Raja Maha Viharaya
description: The historic cave temple of Gatabaru Raja Maha Viharaya is locted in a very scenic spot in between the Rakwana mountain range and the Singharaja mountain range. This means although it located at an elevation of 1500 feet above sea level, mountains still soar all around it.

name: Bopath Ella Falls
description: The 30 meter high Bopath Ella Falls are a popular tourist attraction and has an interesting myth about it. The falls got their name from the Bo Tree as they form a shape similar to the Bo leaf. The myth associated to the falls tells of a treasure hidden somewhere in their waters.

name: Nakha Vehera
description: Nakha Vehera is one of only four temples in Sri Lanka that have square stupas. This plus another two are in Anuradhapura whilst the forth and most famous one is in, what was, the Polonnaruwa kingdom.

name: St. Catherines Seat
description: Providing breathtaking views of the Uva Basin and surrounding mountains St. Catherines Seat is located on the Nayabedda Tea Estate. This tea estate is in the Poonagala hills which has many other good scenic points as well.

name: Rumassala Hill
description: Rumassala Hill is covered in forests which are home to much wildlife and the top of the hill offers great views of the Sri Lankan coastline south of Galle. According to ancient chronicles though, this hill was originally part of the Himalaya Mountains but was brought to Sri Lanka due to the medicinal plants in its forest.

name: Aradunu Ella Fall
description: Unfortunately, due to a hydro-electric plant diverting the waters during the rainy season, the 30 meter high Aradunu Ella Fall can only be seen during the dry season. Legend has it that King Walagamba took refuge in a nearby cave to avoid capture by invaders and that a tunnel at the back of the falls leads to a temple (Passara Raja Maha Vihara).

Hendeniya Rajamaha Vihara
description: Also known as “Galgane Vihara”, Hendeniya Rajamaha Vihara is located on the Kandy-Daulagala Road 12kms from Kandy. It is said that this complex was built on the request of a consort of King Wickremabahu III and was where she stayed when visiting the area in the 14th century.
One of our customer recommend this mechanic.

name: Baker's Falls
description: Named after Sir Samuel Baker a famous explorer, Baker's Falls are 20 meters in height. The falls are located on a tributary of the Belihul Oya in the Horton Plains National Park and are surrounded by Rhododendron and Fern bushes.

name: Patta Ella
description: Patta means belt and so the Patta Ella waterfall was given this name as the 3 meter high falls can look nothing more than a stripe or belt dangling down the mountainside. The falls are located in a small village with the name Rajjuruwatte (meaning ‘king’s estate’) but the nearest town is Kalawana about 1.3kms away.

name: Bambawa Purana Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The small town of Bambawa in the Matale District is said to be the birth place of Kuveni, who is said to have been a wife of the demon Yaksha. Since the 1st century BC however, the town is better known for its abundance of caves in the area. Many of these caves were used as hiding places for King Walagamba but once he gained victory against his enemies he made all the caves he had hidden in, cave temples. Bambawa Purana Rajamaha Viharaya however stands out as it was reconstructed in the 18th century by King Kirthi Sri Rajasinhe.

name: Waduwawa Bambragala Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Consisting of at least 12 caves the Waduwawa Bambragala Rajamaha Viharaya is located in a large rock called Bambragala and legend has it that the king imprisoned the sculptor at the top of the rock. The sculptor’s wife managed to smuggle him a chisel in his food and in just one night, he was able to chisel steps to the bottom of the rock and escape.

name: Hindagala Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Located along the Galaha Road near to the University Campus at Peradeniya, looking picturesque on a large rock is Hindagala Raja Maha Viharaya. This is an ancient cave shrine and monastery which dates back to the 3rd century BC.

name: Pattini Devale - Kandy
description: The Pattini Devale located in Kandy is Sri Lanka’s second most popular shrine devoted to Pattini, the Goddess of Chastity. Although this Goddess is said to have originated in South India she became very popular in Sri Lanka.

name: Padiyadora Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The Sri Lankan Department of Archaeology has designated the ruins of Padiyadora Rajamaha Viharaya as an archaeological monument, not just because it dates back to the 2nd century BC but also because the Bodhi Tree there is thought to be from 1 of the 32 original saplings brought to Sri Lanka and is venerated as such by local Buddhists.

name: Elgin Estate Falls - II
description: Although the main waterfall on the Elgin tea estate is 25 meters tall, there are in fact a total of 5 different waterfalls on the whole estate.

name: Handicraft Emporium, Batticaloa
description: Sri Lanka has a long and rich history as do its people and the people have a rich tradition in handicrafts. The Sri Lanka Handicraft Emporium is a state run showcase for the diverse types of handcrafts Sri Lanka is known for.

name: Polonnaruwa Lankatilaka Image House
description: Entirely made out of bricks with the outer walls covered in elaborate carvings the Lankatilaka Buddha Image House built in the 12th century in Polonnaruwa has an entrance framed by two huge pillars also made from bricks. There is also a 41 foot high Buddha statue at this site which was also made out of clay bricks but sadly it has endured some damage above the shoulders.

name: Samudragiri Viharaya
description: Although during Sri Lanka’s Kandyan Era murals followed a certain style, some, in locations under British rule at the time had a different style, such as those which can be found in the Veragalla Samudragiri Viharaya located in a coconut grove near to Mirissa Beach. Due to its well preserved and unusual murals for its era this temple has now been declared a National Heritage Site.

name: Piyangala Forest Hermitage
description: The Piyangala Forest Hermitage is located about 27kms outside Ampara on the Ampara – Mahaoya and is part of the ruins of a larger monastic complex. About 50 caves have so far been found on the site and by the fact that they have drip ledges indicate they were used by ancient Buddhist priests for meditating.

name: Lewangama Tampita Viharaya
description: Seemingly hidden away at the side of a paddy field in the Kegalle District is the Lewangama Tampita Viharaya. Although this temple was built in the traditional Kandyan style about 300 years ago its image house is far larger than most at a length of 140 feet and a width of 25 feet.

name: Pothana Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Pothana Rajamaha Viharaya is an ancient rock temple located to the west of the Rock Fortress of Sigiriya. Although the temple had been based on 2 large caves, more than 8 others are known to surround them. Excavations in the largest of the caves unearthed animal bones and stone tools which date back to the Mesolithic period, thousands of year ago.

name: Lahugala Kota Vehera
description: Located on the Monaragala – Potvuil at Lahugala is 1 of 4 Kota Vehera Style stupas known of in Sri Lanka. This stupa is said to have been built to commemorate a novice monk who lived on the site in the 2nd century BC and found favour with Queen Viharamahadevi.

name: Pottuvil Lagoon, Arugam Bay
description: Located 4kms from Augam Bay covering 200 acres and thriving with wildlife is the Pottuvil Lagoon. This is a coastal lagoon which is fringed with mangrove forests and in its center has a tiny island. This is rapidly becoming increasingly popular as an eco- tour cruise venue for tourists wanting to experience some of Sri Lanka’s wildlife in their natural habitat.

name: Sri Maha Bodhi (The Sacred Bo-Tree)
description: In the Mahamewna Gardens, Anuradhapura there is what is known as the Sri Maha Bodhi (The Sacred Bo-Tree) which is said to be the southern limb of the historical Sri Maha Bodhi Tree in India under which Lord Buddha received enlightenment.

name: Trincomalee Whale and Dolphin Watching
description: Although Trincomalee is known most of the year round for its harbor and white sandy beaches, from July to September people know it best for its 4 and 5 hour cruise trips to watch the whales and dolphin.

name: Belanbandi Palassa
description: One of Sri Lanka’s most important discoveries is the Mesolithic site Belanbandi Palassa because what has become known as Balangoda Man was found there. These are some human skeletal remains which have proven to date accurately, however tests that have been made date the remains to at least 6,500 years BC.

name: Galpotha (Stone Book) - Polonnaruwa Kingdom
description: The Galpotha (Stone Book) which measures 26’10” feet (8.2 meters) by 4’7” feet (1.4 meters) and contains more than 4300 characters in 72 lines in 3 columns was created by and tells the story of King Nissanka Malla (1187-1196).

name: Udagama Duwili Ella
description: As the water falls on to the rocks at the bottom of the 30 meter high Udagama Duwili Ella falls it creates a mist which is said to be very beautiful. The hydro power of the water at these falls has now been harnessed so as to provide power to 125 local families.

name: Muhathuwaram Beach, Batticaloa
description: Batticaloa Town is a popular destination for visitors to Sri Lanka and one of the top attractions just 5kms from the town is Muhathuwaram Beach which is home to the 28 meter tall lighthouse.

name: Burunnewa Sri Nagarukkarama Tampita Viharaya
description: Hidden away amidst picturesque paddy fields Burunnewa Sri Nagarukkarama Tampita Viharaya is an ancient temple with some excellent features. The features which are of particular note at this temple are the carved wooden statue of Buddha and a small replica of Tampita Viharaya, also in wood.

name: Hathbamba Ella Falls
description: Although the Hathbamba Ella Falls are a popular bathing place with local villagers, due to it not being able to be seen from a road, it is relatively unknown to others. The waterfall is 10 meters high and is located along the Ratnapura – Palawela – Karawita road.

name: Maduwanwela Wallawwa
description: Standing on an 82,000 acre estate the Maduwanwela Wallawwa is the ancestral home to Aduwanwela Disawe, who was known by some as the Dark Prince of Ceylon. The Wallawwa was built in the 1700s by Aduwanwela Disawe’s grandfather on land he was given by two kings after presenting them with the head of an invading Portuguese general.

name: Kalugala Arannanaya
description: Close to the Sinharaja Natural forest reserve is Kalugala Arannanaya, a Buddhist monastery. Thye peace and quiet of the reserve is an iseal place for monks to practice meditation. Founded in 1940 the peaceful setting is helped by the fact that to reach it, monks or visitors alike must hike an hour from the nearest road.

name: Udawalawe National Park
description:
Sri Lanka’s Udawalawe National Park is located in the Uva Provinces 165kms from Colombo. The area was made a National Park in 1972 as the mainly grasslands are important to the Sri Lankan Elephants and some species of water birds.

There are usually many more elephant sightings here than Yala. Yala is known for a higher chance of seeing leopards.

name: Ovagiriya Ancient Ruins
description: The Ovagiriya Ancient Ruins which are dated back to the 5th century are located in the Ampara District of Sri Lanka. When the site was first discovered it was in complete ruins spread over 7 or 8 acres but the Department of Archaeology has now restored some of the statues and have found what seems to be a unique feature, the stupa on an octagonal platform instead of a round or square one.

name: Gonnagolla Punchi Sigiriya Ruins
description: Formally acknowledged by the Sra Lankan government as an archeological site the Gonnagolla Punchi Sigiriya Ruins are located in the Ampara District. Although some frescoes in this cave temple date back to the 3rd century AD, some evidence exists that date the actual temple back as far as the 3rd century BC.

name: Weeragoda Gale Viharaya Archaeological Ruins
description: Covering an area of about 10 acres around a rock plateau in the Ampara District are the Weeragoda Gale Viharaya Archaeological Ruins. One of the ruins on the rock is what remains of a stupa, a 10 foot high mound of earth 75 feet in circumference.

name: Aberdeen falls
description: These falls, located in the Kehelgamuwa mountain range, with a height of 98 meters are among the highest in Sri Lanka and although they can be reached by several routes the easiest is considered to be from Dehigasthenna where you take the path for the Abayawardhanaeama Temple and trek for about 45 minutes. Visitors to the falls also enjoy the nearby wildlife reserve which is known for its leopards as well as elephants and many other endemic species.

name: Magampura Community Development Foundation (Cypetco Fuel Station)
Bundala National Park
description: The Bundala National Park was designated a National Park in 1993 but prior to that since 1969 it had been a Wildlife Sanctuary. The park is internationally known as an important winter stop off point for migratory birds including the Greater Flamingo. In all it is estimated that no fewer than 169 different species of birds use the park as a wintering ground.

name: Kekunadola Rajamaha Viharaya (Prathiraja Pirivena) Tampita Viharaya
description: The Buddhist temple Kekunadola Rajamaha Viharaya is located in the Kalutara District near to the town of Agalawatta. Although the temple was built in the 17th century it is thought that its Bodhi tree was not planted until much later, in 1876.

name: Prasada Stupa ( Indikatu Seya)of the Abayagiri Monastery
description: Stupa with a square base are common in Thailand whilst stupas with a circular base are the norm for Sri Lanka however, the Prasada Stupa (Indikatu Seya) located at the Abayagiri Monastery is one of only four known stupa with square bases in Sri Lanka.

description: Part of a river flowing from the Nayameruhinna mountain range, the 40 meter high Andawala Falls, located at the village of Andawela village in the Nuwara Eliya district can be visited by stopping at the 31 mile post on the Kandy-Regala road. For convenience many visitors to the falls stay at the nearby Hanguranketha rest-house.

name: Batticaloa Lighthouse
description: Batticaloa Lighthouse was built to a height of 29 meters and is located about 5kms from Batticaloa City. Visitors can reach the lighthouse by taking the Lake Road from Kallady Bridge which is a popular route and area for walking and cycling.

name: Sankapala Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Legends say the Sankapala Raja Maha Viharaya was built in the mid-2nd century BC by King Dutugemunu for one of his legendary 10 giants, Pussadeva. Several inscriptions found at the site mention Pussadeva which lends some credence to the legends.

name: Dunsinane Falls
description: As Dunsinane Falls are located between 2 tea estates, Dunsinan and Shin, in the Nuwara Eliya District, it is sometimes referred to as Dunsinance Shine falls. The source of the falls is from a tributary of the Kotmale Oya River known as Pundalu Oya.

description: More of a temporary home for non-venomous snakes caught in the area than an actual snake farm, the Snake Farm at Matara still has between 20 and 40 snakes on any given day and photo ops with them can easily be arranged.

name: Kudagala (Punchi Sigiriya) Archaeological Ruins
description: The rock formation at Kudagala resembles that of the larger Sigiriya and so when frescoes were found in caves there, similar to the ones at Sigiriya, the site became known as Punchi Sigiriya or Kuda (small) Sigiriya.

name: Sri Nilagiri Purana Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Built around the middle of the 3rd century BC Sri Nilagiri Purana Rajamaha Viharaya is known to be the home of that periods mural artists and their families. Rajamaha Viharaya wanted these artists close to hand and so he gifted them land nearby him.

description: All that can be seen of the Dowa Raja Maha Viharaya from the road is what remains of a stupa but carved beneath the stupa is a 38 foot high Buddha Statue. The temple itself also has some secrets as in a cave behind the image house is a tunnel which is said to be 11kms long connecting it to 2 other temples.

name: Katragama Kiri Vehera
description: Katragama is said to be one of the 16 places visited by Buddha during his 3 trips to Sri Lanka and the Kiri Vehera is supposed to have been built on the spot where he used to meditate. Although called Katragama today, it started as a village named Kajara-Gama in the 6th century BC.

name: Sittamgallena Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Warapitiya village which is nestled in the Rammalkanda mountain range’s foothills is home to an ancient cave temple named Rammalkanda mountain range. Although it has been in existence since the 1st century BC this cave temple received attention again in the 11th century as it is said to be where prince Vijayabahu spent 18 years building an army to take back land lost to invaders from South India.

name: Maviddapuram Kanthaswamy Kovil
description: The original Maviddapuram Kanthaswamy Kovil was built on an area of red soil in the Jaffna District in the 8th century. Unfortunately the Portuguese destroyed that temple but it was rebuilt again later by the British.

description: Closed on Mondays and Poya days ( make a call on mention days he will visit the customer location)  Phone Number - 718850210

name: Katuwannawa Asanagharaya
description: Before the Buddha statues started to appear in Sri Lanka in the 2nd century, stone slabs with a footprint of Buddha carved in it would represent him at places of worship. These stone slabs would be protected in structures called Asanaghara but Katuwannawa Asanagharaya is one of the few that still remains in Sri Lanka today.

name: Maniyangama Raja Maha Viharaya
description: To reach the Maniyangama Raja Maha Viharaya you will need to drive up a road which twists and turns as it weaves its way through thick green foliage. The origins of this temple are believed to date back to the 1st century BC however the murals in the shrine room are from the much later Kandyan period.

name: Yatawatta Biso Ella Falls
description: Yatawatta Biso Ella Falls is a 4 meter high waterfall located in the Selagama Tea Estate within the Matale District of Sri Lanka. This waterfall allows a wall of water to flow over it so thin that it almost seems to disappear near the bottom, providing a sort of mystical environment.

name: Wilandagoda Aranya and Archeological Site
description: 4kms from Wilpattu’s southern border an electric fence separates a village from the jungle, ensuring no wild elephants trespass. From there it is only about another 700 meters to the Wilandagoda Aranya and Archeological Site. Although no one is said to have seen all, there are as many as 64 caves at this site but even spending all day there a visitor would be hard pushed to see more than 30.

name: Kulumiwakada Ruins
description: The ancient Kiralagala Aramic Complex is known to have been a huge site but due to the area being taken over by Muslims who turned a lot of the region into paddy fields, exact proportions are not known. The Kulumiwakada Ruins however which are currently being excavated is thought to have been a part of the complex and that lies 4kms from the main site.

name: Seruwila Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The Seruwila Rajamaha Viharaya is accessible via two routes, one is a 45kms drive through dense forests and the other starts with a boat trip and then just another 16kms by road. The site is a large complex however and includes some restorations, such as to the 2nd century stupa which was restored in the 1920s.

name: Polambegoda Sri Sudarshanarma Tampita Viharaya
description: Tampita Viharaya are built on wooden platforms sat atop stone pillars and were a very popular feature at temples built in the Kandyan Era. The one at the Polambegoda Sri Sudarshanarma Tampita Viharaya which was originally built in 1769 is a perfect example of how they once looked as it has been restored twice, once in 1982 and then again in 2014.

name: Round Island Lighthouse
description: Now no longer open and only accessible by boat, the Round Island Lighthouse (Kevuliya lighthouse) was positioned in the Bay of Trincomalee, on a small rocky island, as 1 of 3 lighthouses navigating the ships into its harbor during British rule.

name: Pradeep Motors
description: Please mention that you are a Tuktuk Rental customer.

name: Wegala Watte Ella
description: The 15 meter high Wegala Watte Ella waterfall is located in Sri Lanka’s Matale District. Due to this falls proximity to another waterfall and a hotel it receives a lot of visitors.

name: Nella Archaeological Ruins
description: In the Ampara District near Namal Oya are the Nella Archaeological Ruins. These are the ruins of an ancient Buddhist temple thought to have been built during the reign of Dutugenumu. The ruins already excavated cover a large area but the work is not yet finished and so much more may still be discovered.

name: Kandy Lake
description: Fishing is banned in the artificial Kandy Lake which was created in 1807 by King Sri Wickrama Rajasinghe. The lake today is located in the heart of Kandy but when created it was next to the Temple of the Tooth and was a larger size than it is today. The lake is now a protected area and so hence no fishing is allowed.

name: Tiriyaya Girihandu Seya
description: Tiriyaya Girihandu Seya is located 29kms north of Trincomalee and according to an inscription at the site the temple was founded by 2 merchants, Tapassu and Bhallika who are said to be Buddha’s first 2 disciples.

name: Galkanumandiya Ruins
description: Although clusters of giant pillars such as those at Galkanumandiya Ruins are fairly common in other areas of Sri Lanka, they are rare in the south of the country where these particular ruins are located. The ruins are thought to be the remains of a large monastery which was built on the site in the 1st or 2nd centuries.

name: CEYPETCO Lanka Fuel Filling Station - Karandupona
Rankoth Vehera - Polonnaruwa
description: The ancient temple Rankoth Vehera of Polonnaruwa is home to the largest stupa in Polonnaruwa and the 4th largest in Sri Lanka. According to an inscription on a nearby rock the temple was built in the late 12th century. An unusual feature at this site is that the guard stones at the entrance feature elephants carved on the side instead of the traditional bull.

name: Hanwella Fort - Ruins
description: Throughout Sri Lanka’s history, Hanwella has been part of an important travel route and in the 16th century a fort was built there to secure the route. Although the fort was built in 1521 by King Mayadunne since then it’s control has changed hands several times starting with the Portuguese and then the Dutch.

name: Madunagala Viharaya and Forest Hermitage
description: Due to the many unmarked roads on the 12.5kms drive through the jungle to the Madunagala Viharaya and Forest Hermitage it is advised to take a guide when visiting it. Devotees from all around the world make a pilgrimage to this hermitage where they spend the night so as to prepare breakfast for the monks and then leave having left the monks lunch, the monks do not eat dinner.

name: Nil Garunda Rock
description: Unlike Pink Quartz Rock at Namal Uyana, Nil Garunda Rock (Blue Marble Rock) is hardly known let alone famous and yet it has similar properties but instead of it having the largest deposits of Pink Quartz in Asia, it has the only known deposits of Blue marble in Asia and it is rarely found elsewhere in the world either.

name: Kolapathana Ella
description: The Kolapathana Ella waterfall is located near the small town of Mandaramnuwara in the Nuwara Eliya district. To reach the falls a visitor can get public transport to Mandaram Nuwara from where the falls are just about 700 meters away down a concrete road from the tea factory.

name: Richmond Castle
description: Located on a hill adjoining the Kalu Ganga River at Palatota, surrounded by 42 acres of estate is the Edwardian mansion Richmond Castle. Built in the early 1900s as the “Mudaliyar’s” country seat the mansion now belongs to the Public Trustee and visitors are welcome to tour the two-storey building which boasts 34 windows and 99 doors.

name: Godamunna Ella
description: The Godamunna Ella, which is located 13kms from Kandy may only be seen as water rushing over a stretch of rocks at 30 degrees in the dry season, in the rainy season it turns into a 3 stage, 60 meter high waterfall.

name: Shanthipura
description: The majestic Kikiliyamana Mountain may only be the 5th highest mountain in Sri Lanka but it can boast to being home to the highest village on the island. That village is Shanthipura at an elevation of 7339 feet.

name: Dalada Maluwa Polonnaruwa Kingdom
description: Located in the sacred city of Polonnaruwa the Dalada Maluwa is accessed via some stone steps which have a warning carved beside them. The warning is in the form of 3 carving, 1 of a man pointing the way, 1 of a crow and 1 of a dog. The warning means that if anyone is disrespectful at the site, they will be reborn as either a crow or a dog.

name: Bentota Beach
description: 62kms south of Colombo is a planned tourist development along Bentota Beach. The planning provides all amenities for visitors including shops, banks and entertainment. The beach itself is known as the watersports capital of Sri Lanka and visitors can also take cruises on the Bentota River.

name: Wewelkatiya Pillar Inscription
description: Along the Medawachchiya – Horowpathana road a slab of rock has one of Sri Lanka’s most important inscriptions written on it in letters creating 45 lines of text. Inscribed in the 10th century the inscription details crimes and punishments which were applicable at that time.

name: Ancient Sluice of Kantale Tank
description: Although reservoir building in Sri Lanka reached its peak during 1017-1236, chronicles state that the Ancient Sluice of Kantale Tank was built by King Agbo the II, who reigned from 608-618. It is thought by many experts, however, that King Agbo merely built over an already existing facility. The Statue of King Agbo II is still seen here.

name: Rambaken Oya Canal Ruins
description: Although about 100 meters of the ancient Rambaken Oya Canal Ruins have been restored a new canal project is underway. The original canal would have been built in the 12th century according to nearby inscriptions but the Rambaken Oya shows evidence of being a reservoir since as early as the 2nd century BC.

name: Lahugala Kitulana National Park
description: In October 1980 the Lahugala Kitulana National Park came into existence and although one of the smallest National Parks in Sri Lanka is a must visit place for elephant enthusiasts. Visitors to the park though may also see other wildlife such as birds, deer, leopards and other cat species.

name: Sri Pada (Adam's Peak)
description: Adam’s peak is a mountain in Sri Lanka,s Central Highlands and is considered to be a holy mountain. Why Buddhists consider this mountain as holy is because just below the summit there is a Sri Pada (Buddha’s Footprint). As well as the Sri Pada, the excellent scenic views afforded from the top of Adam’s Peak make this mountain popular with hikers.

name: Diyan Ella Falls
description: The 20 meter high Diyan Ella Falls is sourced by a double stream and is only one of many waterfalls in the Walawe Valley. Located 25kms from Balangoda although there are 2 routes to the falls both require the use of a 4 wheel drive vehicle.

name: Surulumahamuniyawa Rajamaha Viharaya
description: The Surulumahamuniyawa Rajamaha Viharaya may now lie in ruins but as late as the 18th century this was one of the most important temples in Sri Lanka. It wqas known as a great place of learning and fortunately the Department of Archaeology has preserved its stupa and image house for future generations.

name: Hathe Ella
description: The 28 meter high Hathe Ella is a recently discovered waterfall in Dediyagala, Akuressa. The waterfall was discovered in 2007 when an expedition on behalf of the Lanka Council on Waterfalls (LCWF) was asked to find and take pictures of rarely seen waterfalls.

name: Gangaramaya Raja Maha Vihara - Lewella
description: Located in Lewella the Gangaramaya Raja Maha Vihara is famous for its murals depicting Kandyan Sittara art. There is an inscription at the temple describing how it was built in the 18th century by King Kirti Sri Rajasinhe.

name: Wegama Rajamaha Viharaya
description: Although Wegama Rajamaha Viharaya is thought to have been built in the 14th century, evidence shows that the caves at the site have been used as temples for a lot longer, perhaps from as early as the 1st century BC.

name: Kuchchaveli Pichchamal viharaya
description: Like many other coastal temples much of the Kuchchaveli Pichchamal viharaya has been eroded by the sea. Inscriptions carved into the rock face around this temple dates it to being built in the 2nd century.

name: Mohini Ella Falls
description: Located near the town of Maskeliya is the 30 meter high Mohini Ella Falls. Due to a legend local villagers will not visit these falls at night. The legend states that a female devil, Mohini, who the falls are named after, lives in the area and visits the falls at night.

name: Toppigala Heritage Park
description: Located 40kms Northwest of Batticaloa Thoppigala was virtually isolated for 30 years due to the civil war. Now that things have normalized the Sri Lankan army, in an effort to revitalize the region are administering the Toppigala Heritage Park.

name: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
description: Located in the Matale District is the ancient rock fortress of Sigiriya which is atop a huge rock that rises 200 meters above its surrounds. Built in the 5th century the site today is a UNESCO World heritage Site.

name: Devagiri Raja Maha Viharaya - Bingiriya
description: Dating back to the 3rd century BC, Devagiri Raja Maha Viharaya is located in Bingiriya in the Kurunegala District. According to legend the temple was built on a site where many relics were placed in a casket but the casket later became buried.

name: Nanu Oya Ella Falls
description: As if to add to the impressive view as the 60 meter Nanu Oya Ella Falls cascades down over 25 steps, a bridge has been built over the falls for a scene of nature and engineering combined.

name: Wegiriya Rajamaha Viharaya and Devalaya
description: The Wegiriya Rajamaha Viharaya and Devalaya located on the Gampola Kandy Road at the Kalu Wahalkada Junction have two beautiful moonstones. One of the moonstones is at the entrance to the Viharaya whilst the second is at the entrance to the Devalaya. This temple has a long history dating back to the pre-Christian era.

name: Lovamahapaya
description: If the Sinhalese chronicle can be believed, when built in the 2nd century BC, Lovamahapaya was a 9 stories building with 1000 rooms and 100 windows on each floor. The building was built on 1600 pillars, 40 rows with 40 pillars each. Even if the chronicle is exaggerated though, by what is left today this was certainly a very impressive building for any era.

name: Dodan Gallena Ella Falls
description: The waters that flow down the 30 meter high Dodan Gallena Ella Falls will finally reach the Walaweganga River. The waterfalls are located in Medakanda which is 4kms from Balangoda along the Wewelwatte road.

name: Wolvendaal Church
description: One of Sri Lanka’s most important buildings left over from Dutch colonial rule is the Wolvendaal Church which is also one of the oldest protestant churches in Sri Lanka which is still in use today. The church is located in the Pettah neighbourhood of Colombo.

name: Devinuwara Upulvan (Vishnu) Devale
description: In the 17th century the King of the Kandyan Kingdom built the Devale at Devinuwara for the Vishnu Deity. In the month of July the shrine attracts devotees from around the country to celebrate Esala Poya which is in honour of the deity Upuvan.

name: Neluwa village experience by Duara travels
description: Duara Travel offer foreign visitors a unique Sri Lanka experience. Sharing profits with village communities they arrange for visitors to stay several days in the care of actual villagers, in their homes. There are several villages used and Neluwa is one of them but all of them afford the visitors to experience, first hand, Sri Lankan village life.

name: Devagiri Raja Maha Viharaya - Uda Tambana
description: Although the stupa at the Devagiri Raja Maha Viharaya in Uda Tambana has suffered from treasure hunters, 3 symbols still remain carved into the rock on which the stupa stood. The symbols are of a lion’s footprint, Buddha footprint and of a Bahirawa.

name: Dunhinda Ella Falls
description: The Dunhinda Ella Falls are considered one of Sri Lanka’s most beautiful waterfalls and is 64 meters high. The falls are sometimes referred to as Bridal Falls as the shape of the falls resemble a bride’s veil.

name: Wasgamuwa National Park
description: The Wasgamuwa National Park which spans both the Matale and Polonnaruwa Districts is one of the few places in Sari Lanka where large herds of wild elephants can still be seen.

name: Okandagala Ella Falls
description: Although the Okandagala Ella Falls dries up completely in the dry season, at a height of 63 meters it presents a spectacular sight during the monsoon season. Looking down to the bottom of the falls from the rocks above, it seems like the falls start from the sky.

name: Lagoon Park, Batticaloa
description: Lagoon Park in Batticaloa is located on Bar Road and visitors can either take short motor boat rides to some of the lagoon’s islands or rent kayaks or paddle boats by the hour.

name: Lankatilaka Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Built on top of a large rock overlooking the Hantane mountain range the Lankatilaka Raja Maha Viharaya looks majestic and is thought to have been one of the best architectural works of the 14th century. The king who built this temple is said to have had help in the design by a South Indian architect.

name: Eth Pokuna (Elephant Pond)
description: Located close to Lankaramaya there is manmade pool 75,000 cubic meters of water named Eth Pokuna. Understood to have been made several hundred years ago it fills with water via underground tunnels made from stone slabs and some of these tunnels still seem to work up to the present day. It is believed that the pool was used bu more than 5000 monks from the nearby Abayagiri Monastery.

name: Kotaganga Ella Waterfall
description: With at least 7 segments making a total height of 100 meters, the Kotaganga Ella Waterfall is located in the Knuckles Mountain Range in the Kandy District. Although it is possible to visit these falls, getting a guide is advised.

name: Girisiri Darshanarama Purana Tampita Viharaya
description: Although Batuwita is just a small village located between Urapola and Amirthigala it is well-known to it being the home to Girisiri Darshanarama Purana Tampita Viharaya. Tampita Viharaya means Temple on Pillars and accordingly this temple sits on a wooden platform which sits on large stone pillars.

name: Ella Rock
description: A popular attraction for hikers in Sri Lanka is Ella Rock. Passing along a railway, rubber plantation and tea estate, the hike up and down Ella Rock will take about 4 hours. Although the route gets harder as you near the top it is still manageable for experienced hikers.

name: Ambalama at Kadugannawa
description: Built in the 1800 whilst Sri Lanka (then Ceylon) was under British rule, Kadugannawa Ambalama was meant as a rest stop for merchants and travellers travelling between Colombo to Kandy in the mountains. Originally built in the style of Kandyan Era architecture, it has more recently been renovated, with the Department of Archeology guidance, by the Ministry of Tourism and is today considered to be a national heritage item of Sri Lanka.

name: Madanagiri (Mohini) Ella Falls
description: Madanagiri Ella Falls also known as Mohini Ella falls is credited with being 69 meters high and is located in the Ratnapura District. The falls can be found 26kms from Ratnapura on the road to Weweltanne.

name: Kotapola Ella Falls
description: Even though the amount of water that flows over the Kotapola Ella Falls has reduced recently due to a hydroelectric plant being placed above it, it is still a very enchanting 54 meter high waterfall which unfortunately few people know of. The waterfall is about 4kms from a village with the same name and can be accessed via the hydro plant road past Urubokka.

name: W A Perera and Son Dealer Lanka I.O.C
Mirissa Beach
description: Although many of the beaches in Sri Lanka are becoming overcrowded that is never the case at Mirissa Beach. Although this beach has sea, sand and sun just like the others, as well as food and cocktails available nearby, it provides visitors with a chance to relax in an un-clustered environment.

name: Seethawaka Botanic Gardens
description:
Covering an area of 106 acres of what was once a tea and rubber plantation in the Sinharaja Rain Forest region the, although called the Seethawaka Botanic Gardens, is more of a research center for the protection of endangered species. Creation of the gardens, as they are today, started in 2008 but did not open to the public until 2014.

Not really a hike but a walk!

name: Rawa Ela Maligathanne Ruins
description: In Sri Lanka there are 3 archaeological sites with the name Maligathanne but the Rawa Ela Maligathanne Ruins are the ruins of a monastic complex covering 16 acres in the Rawa Ela Jungle discovered in 1997. Excavations have so far uncovered building, ponds and more but what is of particular note is the meditation path which, with a length of 50 feet and a width of 25, is the longest yet found in such a complex.

name: Kandy Natha Devale
description: Said to be the oldest structure in Kandy, the Kandy Natha Devale is located on the terrace of the palace complex. Lord Natha plays a prominent role in Buddhism as Lord Buddha said he was continuously fighting for Buddhism in order to protect it for 5000 years. The Natha Devale therefore takes a prominent place in the annual Devale processions.

name: Maraluwawa Raja Maha Viharaya
description: Andagala (Eel Rock) Rock is a huge eel shaped rock 15kms long located just outside of Kurunegala town. It is on top of this rock where Maraluwawa Raja Maha Viharaya can be found. The temple dates back to the 2nd century BC but is perhaps best remembered from the 18th century when the Kandyan King donated some copper plates to the temple.

name: The Pepper Cottage - community-run jungle escape
description:
Nestled in the hills east of Kandy, The Pepper Cottage is a peaceful hideaway surrounded by spice gardens, birdsong, and mountain views. It’s the perfect place to pause your tuktuk journey, unwind, and connect with nature.

The cottage is lovingly cared for by the direct neighbours, who prepare delicious home-cooked Sri Lankan meals and keep the place warm and welcoming. Every stay directly supports the surrounding village, making your visit part of the community.

With cozy bedrooms, a big veranda for morning tea, and easy access to waterfalls and the Knuckles Mountain Range, this is a retreat for slow travelers, nature lovers, and anyone seeking an authentic, off-the-beaten-path experience.

👉 Stay here to recharge, eat like a local, and experience Sri Lanka’s hill country at its most genuine.

name: Kataboola Ella Falls
description: Although the Kataboola Ella Falls has a total height of 8 meters it cascades down in stages, sometimes as if unhurriedly but in a rush during rainy periods. On the final section of the falls an old arch bridge crosses the waters and if the falls are in full rush, spray can be experienced on the bridge.

name: Oluvil Lighthouse
description: Built in 199 the Oluvil Lighthouse was the first to be built after Sri Lanka received its independence and even though it received some damage during the 2004 tsunami it has since been successfully repaired.

name: Diyawetena Ella Fall
description: At the 8kms post on the Keppatipola – Boralanda road lies the village of Alawathugoda from which access is given to several waterfalls including the Diyawetena Ella Fall. From the waterfall it is possible to see “Five Thousand Foot Rock” (Pandas Gala), a height above which clearing forest areas is banned.

name: The Sigirya Handy man
description: Gentleman has been making small copper items for the past 37 years, teaching his son how to do it now. Handmade and reasonably priced!

name: Polonnaruwa Vatadage (The Stupa House)
description: A stupa house is a name which has been given to a stupa which has a roof covering it and so, as like the one at Polonnaruwa Vatadage it is often smaller than traditional stupas. Although this stupa was probably built prior to the late 12th century there are indications it received renovations and embellishments at that time.
